meanings.definition: A hereditary name common to all members of a family, as distinct from a given name.
meanings.sent1: My surname is Smith, which means it's the name my whole family shares.
meanings.sent2: The surname 'Johnson' has been in our family for generations.
meanings.sent3: When we played a game of family trivia, my surname was the answer to the final question!
meanings.sent4: The surname acts as a bridge connecting me to my ancestors and their stories.
meanings.sent5: I always feel a sense of pride when I hear someone say my surname out loud.

meanings.sent1: Our surname, 'Garcia', is of Spanish origin.
meanings.sent2: She decided to keep her maiden surname after getting married.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, everyone proudly displayed their surname on custom t-shirts.
meanings.sent4: The surname is like a flag that represents our family's history and traditions.
meanings.sent5: I can't wait to pass on our surname to future generations.
